title.rendered: Madhya Pradesh vs Bengal, Indian First-Class Trophy 2022-23: Today’s Match Preview, Fantasy Cricket Tips

content.rendered:
We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable XIs

Madhya Pradesh: Yash Dubey, Himanshu Mantri (wk), Shubham Sharma, Harsh Gawli, Aditya Shrivastava (c), Rajat Patidar, Anubhav Agarwal, Saransh Jain, Avesh Khan, Gaurav Yadav, Kumar Kartikeya

Bengal: Abhimanyu Easwaran, Abishek Porel (wk), Akash Deep, Akash Ghatak, Anustup Majumdar, Ishan Porel, Kazi Saifi, Manoj Tiwary (c), Mukesh Kumar, Shahbaz Ahmed, Sudip Kumar Gharami

Pitch Report

Venue: Holkar Cricket Stadium, Indore

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 351

2nd innings average score: 212

3rd innings average score: 187

4th innings average score: 183

Wickets per innings: 9

Type: Good for pace

Wins

Batting 1st: 33%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Tips of The Day

Avesh Khan‘s 26 of 36 wickets came in Indore.

Madhya Pradesh have three batters who have scored over 500 runs this season: Rajat Patidar, Himanshu Mantri, and Shubham Sharma.

Between them, Akash Deep and Ishan Porel have taken 54 wickets at an average of 23. Their medium pace is best suited for these conditions.

Abhimanyu Easwaran averages a whopping 92 in this edition. In his last 10 First-Class games, he has scored six hundreds and four fifties.

Anustup Majumdar and Sudip Kumar Gharami have been scoring well in tandem at nos. three and four. Between them, they have added over 1,100 runs for Bengal. Madhya Pradesh will have to give their all to get rid of Bengal’s top order.

Shahbaz Ahmed has been keeping fantasy players happy with his dual skills. In 6 matches, he has scored 296 runs at 72 and scalped 17 wickets including the best figures of 5 for 32.

All three five-wicket hauls in the last three games at the venue belonged to pacers.
